name: diaproteomics-dia-discovery
title: Data-Independent Acquisition Analysis
description: Automated quantitative analysis of data-independent acquisition (DIA) proteomics mass spectrometry data using OpenSwathWorkflow. Performs library search, FDR rescoring, chromatogram alignment, and protein quantification from DIA RAW files (mzML) with optional spectral library generation from DDA measurements. Samplesheet format: `Sample,Condition,Fraction,Replicate,SpectraFile`
content:
DIA Proteomics: Data-Independent Acquisition Analysis

Quantitative Analysis of DIA Mass Spectrometry Data

The nf-core/diaproteomics pipeline is an automated bioinformatics workflow for quantitative processing of data-independent acquisition (DIA) proteomics mass spectrometry measurements. Built on the OpenSwathWorkflow for SWATH-MS proteomic data, it delivers comprehensive protein quantification and statistical analysis from raw DIA files.

Key Features

  • DIA Targeted Extraction: Process DIA RAW files (mzML format) using spectral library search

  • Optional Spectral Library Generation: Create libraries from multiple matched DDA measurements using EasyPQP

  • FDR Rescoring: Advanced false discovery rate control using Pyprophet with competitive target-decoy approach

  • Chromatogram Alignment: Retention time alignment across samples using DIAlignR

  • Protein Quantification: Statistical analysis and quantification with MSstats

  • Multiple Analysis Levels: FDR control at peakgroup, peptide, and protein levels

Workflow Overview

The pipeline processes mass spectrometry data through several key stages:

1. Input Processing

  • DIA Files: Mass spectrometry raw data in mzML format

  • Spectral Library: Pre-built library or generated from DDA measurements

  • iRT Standards: Optional internal retention time standards for alignment

2. Library Search & Extraction

  • OpenSwathWorkflow: Targeted extraction of peptide signals from DIA data

  • Feature Detection: Identification of chromatographic peaks matching library entries

  • Score Calculation: Multiple scoring metrics for peptide identification confidence

3. Statistical Processing

  • Pyprophet: Statistical rescoring and FDR estimation using semi-supervised learning

  • Multi-level FDR: Control false discoveries at peakgroup, peptide, and protein levels

  • Target-Decoy Competition: Rigorous statistical validation of identifications

4. Alignment & Quantification

  • DIAlignR: Align chromatograms across runs for accurate quantification

  • MSstats: Statistical modeling for protein-level quantification

  • Differential Analysis: Compare protein abundances between experimental conditions

Input Requirements

Sample Sheet Format

The input sample sheet defines your DIA experiment structure:

Sample,Condition,Fraction,Replicate,SpectraFile
Sample1,Control,1,1,/path/to/sample1.mzML
Sample2,Control,1,2,/path/to/sample2.mzML
Sample3,Treated,1,1,/path/to/sample3.mzML
Sample4,Treated,1,2,/path/to/sample4.mzML

Required Files

  • DIA mzML Files: Mass spectrometry raw data in open mzML format

  • Spectral Library: TSV format library with peptide sequences, masses, retention times

  • Library Sheet: Metadata file describing spectral library organization

Analysis Outputs

Quantification Results

  • Peptide-level Quantification: Intensity matrices for all identified peptides

  • Protein-level Quantification: Aggregated protein abundances with statistical confidence

  • Quality Scores: FDR q-values and posterior error probabilities

  • Aligned Chromatograms: Retention time corrected peak areas

Statistical Analysis

  • Differential Expression: Statistical comparison between experimental groups

  • FDR-controlled Results: High-confidence identifications at specified FDR thresholds

  • Visualization Plots: QC plots, chromatograms, and statistical summaries

Quality Control

  • MultiQC Report: Comprehensive quality metrics across all samples

  • Identification Statistics: Numbers of peptides and proteins at various FDR levels

  • Alignment Quality: Retention time correction and alignment performance

Core Tools

The pipeline integrates industry-standard proteomics software:

  • OpenSwathWorkflow: DIA data extraction and targeted proteomics

  • EasyPQP: Spectral library generation from DDA search results

  • Pyprophet: Statistical validation and FDR estimation

  • DIAlignR: Chromatogram alignment across runs

  • MSstats: Protein quantification and differential analysis

Use Cases

Perfect for Research In:

  • Clinical proteomics and biomarker discovery

  • Drug target identification and validation

  • Systems biology and pathway analysis

  • Comparative proteomics across conditions

  • Protein expression profiling

  • Post-translational modification analysis

Important Notes

Nextflow Version Compatibility: This pipeline uses DSL1 syntax and is compatible with Nextflow versions up to 22.10.6. It will not work with newer Nextflow versions without updates.

Resource Requirements: DIA proteomics analysis is computationally intensive. LARGE compute resources are recommended for processing multiple samples or complex datasets.

Data Format: Input files must be in mzML format. Convert proprietary vendor formats (e.g., .raw, .wiff) to mzML using MSConvert before running the pipeline.

Built with Nextflow • Powered by nf-core/diaproteomics v1.2.4 • Containerized execution • Continuous integration tested

spec.label: Sample Sheet
spec.name: input
spec.description: CSV/TSV samplesheet with columns: Sample, Condition, Fraction, Replicate, SpectraFile (paths to mzML files).

spec.label: Output Directory
spec.name: outdir
spec.description: Output directory for analysis results including quantification matrices, QC reports, and aligned chromatograms.

jobConfig.label: System Size
jobConfig.name: system_size
jobConfig.description: Resource allocation for DIA proteomics processing. LARGE recommended for multiple samples.

options.label: LARGE (64 CPUs, 360GB RAM) - Recommended for DIA analysis
